title: VIENNA – Partyless Strache announces comeback
text:
The former vice-chancellor and leader of far-right (FPÖ), Heinz-Christian Strache, announced his return to the political scene as candidate for the Viennese elections in October 2020 with his own – as yet unnamed – party.

As Austria’s most influential far-right politician and party leader of the FPÖ, his party had formed a coalition government with Chancellor Sebastian Kurz’s ÖVP in 2017, in which he had acted as vice-chancellor. Yet, the Ibiza video scandal ousted him from government, along with the entire coalition. Later, the FPÖ threw him out after some additional corruption scandals came to light.

Strache’s re-emergence could be bad news for the FPÖ, since Strache had been popular in the capital and might draw voters away.

Other parties would benefit from a split in the far-right – especially the social democrats (FPÖ), who traditionally held Vienna but were faced with an ever-growing Viennese support for the FPÖ.(Philipp Grüll | EURACTIV.de)
